alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Marion (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 15 at 5:52PM CDT until May 15 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL CLINTON AND NORTHERN MARION COUNTIES IN SOUTH CENTRAL ILLINOIS... At 552 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is expected. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Salem, Sandoval, Odin, Kinmundy, Farina, Fairman, Shattuc, Stephen Forbes Station, Tonti, Hoffman, Alma, Brubaker and Ferrin. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 in Illinois near exit 127. Thunderstorms have ended, but runoff from heavy rain is continuing. Remain alert for rising water and flash flooding into this evening. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
